review: I highly recommend the Fire TV stick to anyone looking to leave their subscription tv service.  I was previously paying about $170 for basic satellite tv and internet and ditched them as soon as my contract was up.  (I actually tried to do so earlier, but quickly found out that there isn't a way out of the contract cancellation fee)  Anyhow, when I left satellite behind for a $40 cable internet plan, I knew I'd need some alternative for the kids other than dvds, as I'm about to have twins and will need to entertain the big brothers while I care for newborns. I almost bought a Roku box, but then a friend suggested the streaming stick.  I am glad I went with the fire stick, since it comes automatically with the remote, while others are sold separately.  The streaming stick also costs much less than the box and does not need to take up any space in our media center.Now we can watch Netflix, Prime, and Hulu and I am paying less than half of what I was before for entertainment.  I can rent movies from Prime without leaving the house, have endless Curious George with no commercials, and watch current tv shows on hulu for so much cheaper.  To top it off, now that the boys are done with naps, we now have "quiet time" after lunch where we sit down and watch nature shows.  Our family is loving it!Note:  if you press a button on the remote and it acts "stuck" and goes out of control, then that means you need to replace the battery in it.
author: Stephanie Bloomer
